meanings.definition: To feed again or provide food after a period of deprivation.
meanings.sent1: After the long journey, the tired horse needed to refeed on fresh hay.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird will refeed her chicks with worms she finds in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The hungry caterpillar decided to refeed on the juicy leaves for a second time.
meanings.sent4: The farmer knew he had to refeed the livestock to keep them healthy and strong.
meanings.sent5: The athlete quickly refeeds on energy bars to regain strength after a tough workout.

meanings.definition: The act of feeding again or providing food after a period of deprivation.
meanings.sent1: The refeed of the stray cats in the neighborhood was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper scheduled a refeed for the lions in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected refeed of the bears at the zoo caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The refeed of the hungry children at the shelter brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The refeed of the fish in the aquarium was carefully monitored by the marine biologist.
